content.rendered:
Good morning, Shabbat Shalom. A short time ago, our planes returned home safely after attacking military targets in Iran. This action was in response to Iran’s recent attacks on the State of Israel, and the operation was completed successfully, achieving its goals under the guidance of the political echelon.

Over the past year, Israel has faced repeated attacks from Iran. In response, we targeted Iran’s ground-to-air missile systems and air capabilities, which were designed to restrict Israel’s freedom of action in the air. Now, the State of Israel has greater air freedom over Iran. Iran has attacked Israel twice, including incidents affecting civilians, who paid the price. We remain focused on our broader objectives in Gaza and Lebanon, but Iran continues to push for regional escalation, which will come at a heavy cost.

The IDF maintains a continuous situational system, and currently, there is no change in the directives from the Home Front Command. Citizens are required to continue following these instructions as they have throughout the war. The IDF is prepared for both offense and defense and will do everything necessary to protect the citizens of Israel.

Questions & Answers

News Question 12: How should Israeli citizens conduct themselves after the attack on Iran, especially since today is Saturday?

  • We are conducting an ongoing assessment following the attack in Iran. At this time, there is no change in the Home Front Command’s directives. I ask the public to remain vigilant and continue to follow instructions. If there are any updates, we will inform you immediately.

Follow-up: Is Israel preparing for an immediate counter-operation against Iran?

  • The IDF remains ready in both offensive and defensive formations. We have precise targeting capabilities, allowing us to strike exactly where needed. Our close coordination with the American Central Command continues, and we will take appropriate actions as necessary.

excerpt.rendered: IDF strikes Iran in response to attacks, enhancing air freedom. Citizens advised to follow current Home Front Command directives.
